page.title: 04Llangeitho Show.
page.content: Llangeitho Show is held in August, in Tyndolau Fields beside the River Aeron,100 metres from the Square.There are about 1,300 entries into 252 classes.Among the 500 animals entered are cattle breeds which include the Welsh Black.The horse show includes a fancy dress show,a gymkhana for the children,and the very popular Welsh Cob class.The sheep are mainly Welsh Mountain and Suffolk cross and there are of sheepdogs in the dog show as well as the usual breeds. Locally reared goats are very popular now. In the one large marquee are examples of home-baking,home-grown fruit and vegetables,and home-produced wine. There are donkey and trap rides to be had,raffle tickets to be bought, cups and rosettes to be won,and for the energetic,an evening disco.
